pkgmetadata.longdescription: tini----A simple module for loading ``.ini``-style configuration files.Based on`ConfigParser <https://docs.python.org/3/library/configparser.html>`__and works in Python 2 and Python 3.Running tests~~~~~~~~~~~~~.. code:: bash $ py.testOr, with ``tox`` (test with multiple Python versions):.. code:: bash $ toxExample~~~~~~~settings.py^^^^^^^^^^^.. code:: python import os import sys from tini import Tini filenames = [ './foobar.ini', os.path.join(os.path.expanduser('~'), '.foobar.ini'), os.path.join(os.path.expanduser('~'), '.config', '.foobar.ini'), ] defaults = { 'foobar': { 'baz': 'a string', 'buzz': True, 'bizz': 123, } } sys.modules[__name__] = Tini(filenames, defaults=defaults)foobar.ini^^^^^^^^^^:: [foobar] buzz = falsetest.py^^^^^^^.. code:: python import settings assert settings.foobar['baz'] == 'a string' assert settings.foobar['buzz'] is False assert settings.foobar['baz'] == 123
